articles.description: Everyone thought the Crimson Tide was safe coming into championship weekend. But does Alabama's 21-point loss to Georgia create an opportunity for both Miami and Notre Dame to make the 12-team field?

articles.title: Indiana prevails over Ohio State for Big Ten title - ESPN
articles.description: No. 2 Indiana defeated No. 1 Ohio State for the Hoosiers' first Big Ten championship since 1967 and likely the top seed in the College Football Playoff.

articles.title: Cavs booed at home during 99-94 loss to Golden State Warriors - Cleveland.com
articles.description: About 24 hours after a come-from-behind win, the undermanned Cavs couldn’t repeat it Saturday night, losing to the equally depleted Golden State Warriors, 99-94, inside Rocket Arena. It’s Cleveland’s fifth loss in the last seven games.

articles.title: No. 4 Duke Rallies for 66-60 Victory at No. 7 Michigan State - Duke University - goduke.com
articles.description: After trailing by five points midway through the second half, No. 4 Duke rallied to defeat No. 7 Michigan State, 66-60, at the Breslin Center on Saturday.

articles.title: Mo Salah to leave Liverpool? Egyptian has 'no relationship with' Slot, says LFC throwing him under bus - NBC Sports
articles.description: Mohamed Salah says he feels he does not have a relationship with Liverpool boss Arne Slot, and says he is unsure if he has a future at Anfield beyond next month's African Cup of Nations

articles.title: World Cup final will be an afternoon match at MetLife Stadium, allowing prime-time viewing in Europe - AP News
articles.description: FIFA has announced the World Cup final will kick off at 3 p.m. EDT on July 19 at MetLife Stadium in New Jersey. The timing allows for prime-time viewing in Europe and Britain. The tournament will feature 104 matches, with the opener in Mexico City on June 11.…
